main.name: Imron
main.description: I know what you're thinking. No its not my dog. Yes I like taking pictures of dogs
main.bio: My name is Imron Hajiahmad and I am currently inspiring the next generation of engineers, scientists, doctors, and world leaders. I have dedicated my life to helping others and improving our world by practicing compassion and integrity on a daily basis. My hunger for knowledge has created a vast set of skills and interests including, programming, medical nutrition therapy, teaching, photography, and foreign languages. If I'm not working/coding, you'll probably find me on the volleyball court, taking artsy pictures of every cute animal possible, treating myself to different foods, making short highlight reels of my life adventures, taking on a new challenging skill, or trying to learn a new language. 様々な外国語ペラペラなりたいよ〜.
main.contactmessage: Down to collab? Send me an email! A confirmation email will be sent to the address you provide.

resume.skillmessage: Summary of some of my technical skills

education.description: Completed three full stacks in Python, Swift, and MEAN (MongoDB, Express.js, Angular, and Node.js) to earn a Triple Blackbelt title
Graduated from UC Davis with a degree in Clinical Nutrition and Japanese.

work.title: Instructor, Logistics Coordinator
work.description: Created custom python scripts to automate certain processes and procedures to increase instructor efficiency by over 50%. Actively improved nearly 100% of student's math test scores within months of attendance by using Singapore Mathematics to instill confidence and conceptual understanding of core topics. Implemented new processes and procedures to improve instructor grading time, accuracy, teaching methodology, and communication between instructors, students, and parents.

work.title: Coding Instructor, Coach
work.description: Improved teaching methodology to effectively teach large classrooms of 30 students to ignite interest and curiosity in coding and science.

work.title: IT and Systems Administrator
work.description: Created, tested and implemented new scripts for NetSuite to help automate tasks and increase efficiency for sales, marketing, and current vendors. Updated currently deployed scripts from SuiteScript 1.0 to SuiteScript 2.0 to increase code reusability and readability.

work.title: Dietetic Assistant
work.description: Helped increase patient satisfaction by 20% through prioritizing patient health, safety, and satisfaction by meticulously and accurately processing patient care orders. Provided input on current and past department policies in order to improve departmental productivity, patient safety, patient satisfaction, and overall hospital performance despite increasing patient population. Ensured that patient meal preferences adhere to dietary restrictions by contacting individuals to discuss current therapeutic prescriptions, allergies, and fluid restrictions with nearly 100% accuracy. Efficiently prioritized time sensitive orders (such as baby formulas, enteral tube feedings, dietary restrictions etc.) in order to provide 100% completion rate of time sensitive material while simultaneously receiving high volumes of phone calls from nurses, doctors, hosts, and other hospital staff.

projects.title: React Tetris

projects.title: React Chat App
projects.category: Basic chat application using React, socket.io, and node.js. Server deployed on heroku and client deployed on netlify

projects.title: MERN Todo List
projects.category: (Not Deployed) Basic Todo List app with CRUD capabilities. Uses mLab, node, express, mongoose, react

testimonials.text: I have two kids ages 7 and 10 and both started this year.  We had to decide between Mathnasium and SAM... Their teacher Imron is the best and much loved by the kids.  Plan to continue as long as we can.
Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
